00029 int ReadFile(const string& path, string* contents, string* err) {
00030   FILE* f = fopen(path.c_str(), "r");
00031   if (!f) {
00032     err->assign(strerror(errno));
00033     return -errno;
00034   }
00035 
00036   char buf[64 << 10];
00037   size_t len;
00038   while ((len = fread(buf, 1, sizeof(buf), f)) > 0) {
00039     contents->append(buf, len);
00040   }
00041   if (ferror(f)) {
00042     err->assign(strerror(errno));  // XXX errno?
00043     contents->clear();
00044     fclose(f);
00045     return -errno;
00046   }
00047   fclose(f);
00048   return 0;
00049 }
00050 
00051 int RealDiskInterface::Stat(const string& path) {
00052   struct stat st;
00053   if (stat(path.c_str(), &st) < 0) {
00054     if (errno == ENOENT) {
00055       return 0;
00056     } else {
00057       Error("stat(%s): %s", path.c_str(), strerror(errno));
00058       return -1;
00059     }
00060   }
00061 
00062   return st.st_mtime;
00063   return true;
00064 }
00065 
00066 string DirName(const string& path) {
00067   string::size_type slash_pos = path.rfind('/');
00068   if (slash_pos == string::npos)
00069     return "";  // Nothing to do.
00070   while (slash_pos > 0 && path[slash_pos - 1] == '/')
00071     --slash_pos;
00072   return path.substr(0, slash_pos);
00073 }
00074 
00075 bool DiskInterface::MakeDirs(const string& path) {
00076   string dir = DirName(path);
00077   if (dir.empty())
00078     return true;  // Reached root; assume it's there.
00079   int mtime = Stat(dir);
00080   if (mtime < 0)
00081     return false;  // Error.
00082   if (mtime > 0)
00083     return true;  // Exists already; we're done.
00084 
00085   // Directory doesn't exist.  Try creating its parent first.
00086   bool success = MakeDirs(dir);
00087   if (!success)
00088     return false;
00089   return MakeDir(dir);
00090 }
00091 
00092 string RealDiskInterface::ReadFile(const string& path, string* err) {
00093   string contents;
00094   int ret = ::ReadFile(path, &contents, err);
00095   if (ret == -ENOENT) {
00096     // Swallow ENOENT.
00097     err->clear();
00098   }
00099   return contents;
00100 }
00101 
00102 bool RealDiskInterface::MakeDir(const string& path) {
00103   if (mkdir(path.c_str(), 0777) < 0) {
00104     Error("mkdir(%s): %s", path.c_str(), strerror(errno));
00105     return false;
00106   }
00107   return true;
00108 }
00109 
00110 FileStat* StatCache::GetFile(const string& path) {
00111   Paths::iterator i = paths_.find(path);
00112   if (i != paths_.end())
00113     return i->second;
00114   FileStat* file = new FileStat(path);
00115   paths_[path] = file;
00116   return file;
00117 }
00118 
00119 void StatCache::Dump() {
00120   for (Paths::iterator i = paths_.begin(); i != paths_.end(); ++i) {
00121     FileStat* file = i->second;
00122     printf("%s %s\n",
00123            file->path_.c_str(),
00124            file->status_known()
00125            ? (file->node_->dirty_ ? "dirty" : "clean")
00126            : "unknown");
00127   }
00128 }

00130 const Rule State::kPhonyRule("phony");
00131 
00132 State::State() : build_log_(NULL) {
00133   AddRule(&kPhonyRule);
00134 }
00135 
00136 const Rule* State::LookupRule(const string& rule_name) {
00137   map<string, const Rule*>::iterator i = rules_.find(rule_name);
00138   if (i == rules_.end())
00139     return NULL;
00140   return i->second;
00141 }
00142 
00143 void State::AddRule(const Rule* rule) {
00144   assert(LookupRule(rule->name_) == NULL);
00145   rules_[rule->name_] = rule;
00146 }
00147 
00148 Edge* State::AddEdge(const Rule* rule) {
00149   Edge* edge = new Edge();
00150   edge->rule_ = rule;
00151   edge->env_ = &bindings_;
00152   edges_.push_back(edge);
00153   return edge;
00154 }
00155 
00156 Node* State::LookupNode(const string& path) {
00157   FileStat* file = stat_cache_.GetFile(path);
00158   if (!file->node_)
00159     return NULL;
00160   return file->node_;
00161 }
00162 
00163 Node* State::GetNode(const string& path) {
00164   FileStat* file = stat_cache_.GetFile(path);
00165   if (!file->node_)
00166     file->node_ = new Node(file);
00167   return file->node_;
00168 }
00169 
00170 void State::AddIn(Edge* edge, const string& path) {
00171   Node* node = GetNode(path);
00172   edge->inputs_.push_back(node);
00173   node->out_edges_.push_back(edge);
00174 }
00175 
00176 void State::AddOut(Edge* edge, const string& path) {
00177   Node* node = GetNode(path);
00178   edge->outputs_.push_back(node);
00179   if (node->in_edge_) {
00180     Error("WARNING: multiple rules generate %s. "
00181           "build will not be correct; continuing anyway", path.c_str());
00182   }
00183   node->in_edge_ = edge;
00184 }
00185 
00186 vector<Node*> State::RootNodes(string* error)
00187 {
00188   assert(error);
00189   vector<Node*> root_nodes;
00190   // Search for nodes with no output.
00191   for (vector<Edge*>::iterator e = edges_.begin(); e != edges_.end(); ++e)
00192     for (vector<Node*>::iterator outs = (*e)->outputs_.begin();
00193          outs != (*e)->outputs_.end();
00194          ++outs)
00195       if ((*outs)->out_edges_.size() == 0)
00196         root_nodes.push_back(*outs);
00197   if (!edges_.empty() && root_nodes.empty()) {
00198     *error = "could not determine root nodes of build graph";
00199   }
00200   assert(edges_.empty() || !root_nodes.empty());
00201   return root_nodes;
00202 }
